sen.j: 玉屋庄兵衛（たまやしょうべい）はからくり人形師。
sen.e: Shobei TAMAYA was a wind-up doll manipulator.
Shobei TAMAYA was a wind-up doll manipulator.
Shobei TAMAYA is a Karakuri-ningyoshi (wind-up doll manipulator).
sen.cmt: 後に「karakuri」という表現が出てくるためここで入れました。was→is

sen.j: 現在9代目。
sen.e: The current head is Shobei TAMAYA, the nineth.

sen.j: 享保18年（1733年）、現在の愛知県名古屋市熱田区伝馬町のからくり人形「鶴」の修理と操作指導のために京都から名古屋を訪れ、翌年名古屋を再訪。
sen.e: In 1733, from Kyoto he visited Nagoya to instruct on repair and manipulation of the wind-up doll 'Tsuru' (crane) at the current Tenma Town, Atsuta Ward, Nagoya City, Aichi Prefecture and next year revisited Nagoya,

In 1733, he visited Nagoya from Kyoto to instruct on the repair and manipulation of the wind-up doll 'Tsuru' (crane) at the current Tenma Town, Atsuta Ward, Nagoya City, Aichi Prefecture, and the next year herevisited Nagoya,

In 1733, he visited Nagoya from Kyoto to instruct on the repair and manipulation of the wind-up doll 'Tsuru' (crane) at the current Tenma Town, Atsuta Ward, Nagoya City, Aichi Prefecture, and the next year he revisited Nagoya,

sen.j: そのまま玉屋町に移り住んだことから玉屋庄兵衛と呼ばれるようになった。
sen.e: and lived in Tamaya Town for good, due to which he came to be called Shobei TAMAYA.
and lived in Tamaya Town for good, and for this reason he came to be called Shobei TAMAYA.
Since then, he lived in Tamaya Town for good, and for this reason he came to be called Shobei TAMAYA.

sen.j: この人物を初代とする。
sen.e: This person is designated to be Shobei TAMAYA, the 1st.
This person is designated Shobei TAMAYA, the 1st.
This person is designated Shobei TAMAYA, the first.

sen.j: 生没年不明。
sen.e: The dates of his birth and death are unknown.
The dates of his birth and death are unknown.
The dates of his birth and death are unknown.

tit.cmt: 原文には「玉屋庄兵衛」はありませんが、訳には入れました。

sen.j: その後、五代目まで玉屋庄兵衛の名は、当代の優れたからくり人形師が受け継いだと考えられている。
sen.e: For each generation from the 2nd to the 5th, the name of Shobei TAMAYA is considered to have been taken over by a distinguished wind-up doll manipulator of those days.
For each generation from the 2nd to the 5th, the name Shobei TAMAYA is considered to have been taken over by a distinguished wind-up doll manipulator of those days.
For each generation from the second to the fifth, the name Shobei TAMAYA is considered to have been taken over by a distinguished wind-up doll manipulator of those days.

sen.j: 1800年代初頭の人物。
sen.e: He was a person who lived in the early 1800s.
He was a person who lived in the early 1800s.
He was a person who lived in the early 1800s.

sen.j: 文政二年（1819年）没とされる。
sen.e: He is understood to have died in 1819.
He is understood to have died in 1819.
He is understood to have died in 1819.

sen.j: 文政頃の人物とされるが詳細不明。
sen.e: He is understood to have been a person who lived around the Bunsei era but the details are unknown.
He is understood to have been a person who lived around the Bunsei era but details of his life are unknown.
He is understood to have been a person who lived around the Bunsei era but details of his life are unknown.

sen.j: 文政頃の人物とされるが詳細不明。
sen.e: He is understood to have been a person who lived around the Bunsei era but the details are unknown.
He is understood to have been a person who lived around the Bunsei era but details of his life are unknown.

sen.j: 幕末から明治にかけての人物で本姓は荒川。
sen.e: He was a person who lived in the periods from the end of Edo to the Meiji and his real name was Arakawa.
He was a person who lived in the periods from the end of the Edo era to the Meiji ear and his real name was Arakawa.
He was a person who lived in the periods from the end of the Edo period to the Meiji period and his real name was Arakawa.

sen.j: 嘉永六年（1853年）頃から玉屋の名での作品が確認されている。
sen.e: His works under the name of TAMAYA have been found from around 1853 on.
His works under the name of TAMAYA have been found from around 1853 on.
His works under the name of Tamaya have been found from around 1853 on.
He died in 1888.
He died in 1888.
He died in 1888.

sen.j: 本名は高科正芳。
sen.e: His real name was Masayoshi TAKASHINA.
His real name was Masayoshi TAKASHINA.
His real name was Masayoshi TAKASHINA.

sen.j: 旧尾張藩士の家系に生まれ、山車の前棚人形を多く手がけた。
sen.e: He was born in a former Owari clansman's family and worked on many of maedana ningyo (maedana doll) of dashi (float).
He was born in a former Owari clansman's family and worked on many maedana ningyo (maedana dolls) of dashi (floats).
He was born in a former Owari clansman's family and worked on many maedana ningyo (literally, front shelf dolls) of dashi (floats).
sen.cmt: 「前棚」の定訳不明ですが、補足しました。

sen.j: 昭和5年（1930年）6月没。
sen.e: He died in June 1930.
He died in June 1930.
He died in June 1930.

sen.j: 本名は高科正守（大正12年（1923年）- 昭和63年（1988年）5月18日）。
sen.e: His real name was Masamori TAKASHINA (1923-May 18, 1988).
His real name was Masamori TAKASHINA (1923-May 18, 1988).
His real name was Masamori TAKASHINA (1923-May 18, 1988).

sen.j: 山車造りを営む家で生まれた父・岩次郎は大正12年に六代目と養子縁組したが、翌年七代目を継ぐことなく死去。
sen.e: His father, Iwajiro who was born in a dashi-constructing family was adopted by Shobei TAMAYA, the 6th in 1923, but died in the following year without taking over the 7th.
His father, Iwajiro, who was born in a dashi-constructing family, was adopted by Shobei TAMAYA, the 6th in 1923, but died in the following year without taking over as the 7th.
His father, Iwajiro, who was born in a dashi-constructing family, was adopted by Shobei TAMAYA, the sixth in 1923, but died in the following year without taking over as the seventh.

sen.j: 昭和5年（1930年）、六代目の死去に伴い7歳で七代目を継いだ。
sen.e: In 1930, he succeeded to Shobei TAMAYA, the 7th at the age of 7 when the 6th died.
In 1930, he succeeded to Shobei TAMAYA, the 7th at the age of 7 when the 6th died.
In 1930, he succeeded to Shobei TAMAYA, the seventh at the age of seven when the sixth died.

sen.j: 全国のからくり人形を直接見て回るなど独学で知識を積み上げ、各地で死蔵されていたからくりの復元に尽したとされるが、その一方で元々と違う形で「修復」することがあり、からくりの研究家などからの評価は高くないとも言われる。
sen.e: He is understood to have accumulated knowledge by self-education like visiting places throughout Japan to see directly wind-up dolls and devoted himself to restore wind-up dolls which had been hoarded up in various places, however, he sometimes 'repaired' wind-up dolls to change the original model, which, it is said, has made him not necessarily evaluated highly by wind-up doll researchers.

He is understood to have accumulated knowledge by self-education such as by visiting places throughout Japan to see directly wind-up dolls and devoted himself to restore wind-up dolls which had been hoarded up in various places; however, he sometimes 'repaired' wind-up dolls to change the original model, which, it is said, has made him not necessarily highly evaluated by wind-up doll researchers.

He is understood to have accumulated knowledge by self-education such as by visiting places throughout Japan to see directly wind-up dolls and devoted himself to restore wind-up dolls which had been hoarded up in various places; however, he sometimes 'repaired' wind-up dolls to change the original model, which, it is said, has made him not necessarily highly evaluated by wind-up doll researchers.

sen.j: 本名は高科正夫（昭和25年（1950年）- 平成7年（1995年）8月23日）。
sen.e: His real name was Masao TAKASHINA (1950-August 23, 1995)
His real name was Masao TAKASHINA (1950-August 23, 1995)
His real name was Masao TAKASHINA (1950-August 23, 1995)

sen.j: 25歳の時に七代目に弟子入り。
sen.e: He apprenticed himself to Shobei TAMAYA, the 7th at the age of 25.
He apprenticed himself to Shobei TAMAYA, the 7th at the age of 25.
He apprenticed himself to Shobei TAMAYA, the seventh at the age of 25.

sen.j: 昭和63年（1988年）に八代目を継ぎ、伝統的なからくりを製作する一方でからくりの制御にコンピューターを導入するなど新しい挑戦も行った。
sen.e: In 1988, he succeeded to Shobei TAMAYA, the 8th and while he constructed traditional wind-up dolls, he made new efforts including the introduction of computer for controlling wind-up dolls.
In 1988, he succeeded to Shobei TAMAYA, the 8th and while he constructed traditional wind-up dolls, he made new efforts, including the introduction of computers for controlling wind-up dolls.
In 1988, he succeeded to Shobei TAMAYA, the eighth and while he constructed traditional wind-up dolls, he made new efforts, including the introduction of computers for controlling wind-up dolls.

sen.j: 平成7年3月には弟に玉屋庄兵衛の名を譲り、初代萬屋仁兵衛と称した。
sen.e: In March 1995, he gave the name of Shobei TAMAYA to his younger brother and named himself Nihei YOROZUYA, the 1st.
In March 1995, he gave the name Shobei TAMAYA to his younger brother and named himself Nihei YOROZUYA, the 1st.
In March 1995, he gave the name Shobei TAMAYA to his younger brother and named himself Nihei YOROZUYA, the first.

sen.j: 同年、癌により病没。
sen.e: In the same year, he died of cancer.
In the same year, he died of cancer.
In the same year, he died of cancer.

sen.j: 本名は高科庄次（昭和29年（1954年）-）。
sen.e: His real name is Shoji TAKASHINA (1954-).
His real name is Shoji TAKASHINA (1954-).
His real name is Shoji TAKASHINA (1954-).

sen.j: 25歳で七代目に弟子入り。
sen.e: He apprenticed himself to Shobei TAMAYA, the 7th at the age of 25.
He apprenticed himself to Shobei TAMAYA, the 7th at the age of 25.
He apprenticed himself to Shobei TAMAYA, the seventh at the age of 25.

sen.j: 平成7年に兄・正夫から玉屋庄兵衛の名を継いだ。
sen.e: In 1995, he took over the name of Shobei TAMAYA from his elder brother, Masao.
In 1995, he took over the name Shobei TAMAYA from his elder brother, Masao.
In 1995, he took over the name Shobei TAMAYA from his elder brother, Masao.

sen.j: 平成17年（2005年）に英国大英博物館に「茶運び人形」を寄贈。
sen.e: In 2005, he donated a tea-serving robot to the British Museum in UK.
In 2005, he donated a tea-serving robot to the British Museum in the UK.
In 2005, he donated a 'tea-serving doll' to the British Museum in the UK.

sen.j: 平成20年（2008年）現在、からくり製作に加えて犬山市の犬山市文化史料館の別館「からくり展示館」でのからくり細工の実演公開などの活動を毎週行なっている。
sen.e: As of 2008, in addition to constructing wind-up dolls, he performs weekly activities at the 'Karakuri exhibition hall,' an annex to the Inuyama City Cultural and Historical Museum in Inuyama City including open demonstrations of wind-up articles.

As of 2008, in addition to constructing wind-up dolls, he performs weekly activities at the 'Karakuri exhibition hall,' an annex to the Inuyama City Cultural and Historical Museum in Inuyama City, including open demonstrations of wind-up articles.

As of 2008, in addition to constructing wind-up dolls, he performs weekly activities at the 'Karakuri exhibition hall,' an annex to the Inuyama City Cultural and Historical Museum in Inuyama City, including open demonstrations of wind-up articles every week.
sen.cmt: 「毎週」 訳漏れ対応しました。
